metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5591 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An incorrect implementation of "XEP-0280: Message Carbons" in multiple XMPP clients allows a remote attacker to impersonate any user, including contacts, in the vulnerable application's display. This allows for various kinds of social engineering attacks. This CVE is for SleekXMPP up to 1.3.1 and Slixmpp all versions up to 1.2.3, as bundled in poezio (0.8 - 0.10) and other products.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5591` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-sleekxmpp - 1.3.3-3
python3-sleekxmpp - 1.3.3-3
No subscription required

python3-slixmpp - 1.2.2-1.1build2
python3-slixmpp-lib - 1.2.2-1.1build2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sleekxmpp package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.3-3').
slixmpp package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.2-1.1build2').
